p: Phenylalanine is very harmful for patients with phenylketonuria, as well as for pregnant mothers who carry a foetus of such metabolopathy. The use of aspartame in patients with phenylketonuria should be avoided. The adverse effects of aspartame that have been described are: neurological (neurotoxicity, epilepsy, headache, panic attack and hallucinations), hypersensitivity reactions (vascular and granulomatous panniculitis) and cross-reaction with sulphonamides [ 29].
